content: to start with this craft I picked up these bones or experiment and these are
perfect and you'll see how we're going to modify these now we're gonna do is
we're gonna cut the spear off right you can just use a little wire cutter and
cut the spear off easy to cut off or you can keep the stick and just cut the
spear off the spear top off and it looks like a staff right so that'll be perfect
for our peons here now here's how I'm gonna use to facilitate the craft it's
liquitex flexible modeling paste and this stuff is great it's it will stick
to the models I it's fairly expensive so I just use it on certain crafts but for
this kind of stuff it's great so here's my work guy and you see I've got the
spear tip cut off and I want to cover up that change shirt because I don't want
to look warrior I wanted to look like a peon so I'm just gonna drag this over
the detail of the change shirt and this stuff is great it'll stick to the model
and it's great takes paint very well and I use this a lot on a lot of mods that I
do for my models right so let's let that dry and then we'll move on do the back
also here are my orc peons side-by-side with Roderick and hilga and I think they
look great I just paint them up with acrylic craft paints they take paint
very well also that paste really obliterated the detail of the change
shirt and all that now it just looks like some rags that this guy is wearing
and more appropriate for something like an orc piana it's just simple enough to
take that weapon away from the guy and so he looks like just you know a slave
or a peon or you know someone who's not a warrior that you can have in your game
you know in the tribe so there we go I hope you enjoyed this easy way to make
orc peons one last note you may have noticed the clear bases that these guys
are on it's something I've been doing lately with my miniatures and I've been
putting them on these clear vases because then you can see more of the
terrain through the base and if you like to pick these up you can check out my
link below
